api.title: UIProgressView
api.description: A view that depicts the progress of a task over time.

overview.description: The UIProgressView class provides properties for managing the style of the progress bar and for getting and setting values that are pinned to the progress of a task.

method.name: init(progressViewStyle: UIProgressView.Style)
method.description: Initializes and returns a progress-view object.

method.name: var progress: Float
method.description: The current progress shown by the receiver.

method.name: func setProgress(Float, animated: Bool)
method.description: Adjusts the current progress shown by the receiver, optionally animating the change.

method.name: var observedProgress: Progress?
method.description: The progress object to use for updating the progress view.

method.name: var progressViewStyle: UIProgressView.Style
method.description: The current graphical style of the receiver.

method.name: var progressTintColor: UIColor?
method.description: The color shown for the portion of the progress bar that is filled.

method.name: var progressImage: UIImage?
method.description: An image to use for the portion of the progress bar that is filled.

method.name: var trackTintColor: UIColor?
method.description: The color shown for the portion of the progress bar that is not filled.

method.name: var trackImage: UIImage?
method.description: An image to use for the portion of the track that is not filled.

method.name: enum UIProgressView.Style
method.description: The styles permitted for the progress bar.

control.name: class UIActivityIndicatorView
control.description: A view that shows that a task is in progress.

control.name: class UIImageView
control.description: An object that displays a single image or a sequence of animated images in your interface.

control.name: class UIPickerView
control.description: A view that uses a spinning-wheel or slot-machine metaphor to show one or more sets of values.

control.name: class UIWebView
control.description: A view that embeds web content in your app.
